articles.content:
Research Room Opened in Internet Homepage of U.S. Study Group 
    Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- "The Research Room on the Red Sun of Militant Socialism of Juche" was opened on Jan. 1 by the U.S. Group for the Study of Songun Politics in its internet homepage.
 Seen in the room are photographs of President Kim Il Sung with leader 
Kim Jong Il. 
 Edited there are at least 30 propositions and wise sayings of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il which the group has excerpted while deeply studying their famous works.

articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends New Year's Cards to Party State Leaders of Various Countries 
    Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il sent New Year's cards to political party and state leaders of many countries on the occasion of the New Year, Juche 93 (2004).
 Addressees included President of the Russian Federation V. Putin, General Secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and President of the People's Republic of China Hu Jintao, Chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Communist Party of China and Chairman of the Central Military Commission of the People's Republic of China Jiang Zemin, First Secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba and  President of the Council of State and President of the Council of  Ministers of the Republic of Cuba Fidel Castro Ruz, President of the Democratic Republic of East Timor Xanana Gusmao, Chairman of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party and President of the Lao People's Democratic Republic Khamtay Siphandone, President of the Republic of Lebanon Emile Lahoud, President of the Republic of Maldives Maumoon Abdul Gayoom, Mongolian President Natsagiin Bagabandi, President of the People's Republic of Bangladesh Iajuddin Ahmed, President of the Syrian Arab Republic Bashar Al Assad, President of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan Pervez Musharraf, President of the State of Palestine, Chairman of the Executive Committee of the Palestine Liberation Organization and Head of the Palestine National Authority Yasser Arafat, President of the Republic of Cyprus Tassos Papadopoulos, President of Turkmenistan Saparmurad Niyazov, President of the Republic of Armenia Robert Kocharyan, President of the Azerbaijan Republic Ilham Aliyev, President of the Republic of Uzbekistan Islam Karimov, President of the Republic of India A.P.J. Abdul Kalam, President of the Republic of Yemen Ali Abdullah Saleh, President of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam Tran Duc Luong, Queen of Denmark Margrethe II, President of the Republic of Macedonia Boris Trajkovski, President of the Republic of Moldova Vladimir Woronin, President of the Republic of Belarus Aleksandr Lukashenko, President of the Republic of Croatia Stipe Mesic, President of the Polish Republic Aleksander Kwasniewski, President of the Republic of Guinea Lansana Conte, President of the Republic of Namibia Sam Nujoma, President of the Republic of South Africa Thabo Mvuyelwa Mbeki, President of the Republic of Rwanda Paul Kagame, President of the Republic of Madagascar Marc Ravalomanana, President of the Republic of Equatorial Guinea Obiang Nguema Mbasogo, President of the Republic of Zimbabwe Robert G. Mugabe, President of the Democratic Republic of Congo Joseph Kabila, President of the Republic of Togo Gnassingbe Eyadema, President of the Republic of Tunisia Zine El Abidine Ben Ali, President of the Algerian Democratic and People's Republic Abdelaziz Bouteflika, President of the Republic of Angola Jose Eduardo Dos Santos, President of the Republic of Uganda Yoweri Kaguta Museveni, President of the Arab Republic of Egypt Mohamed Hosni Mubarak, President of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia Girma Woldegiorgis, President of the Republic of Trinidad and Tobago George Maxwell Richard, Prime Minister of the Kingdom of Cambodia Hun Sen, Prince of the Kingdom of Thailand Maha Vajiralongkorn, Prime Minister of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan Mir Zafarullah Khan Jamali, Prime Minister of the Republic of India Atal Bihari Vajpayee, Prime Minister of the Republic of Malta Eddie Fenech Adami, President of the Council of Ministers of the Kingdom of Spain Jose Maria Aznar, Prime Minister of the Republic of Mauritius Paul Raymond Berenger and Prime Minister of Grenada Keith Mitchell.    
 Kim Jong Il also sent New Year's cards to Russian Presidential Envoy to the Far East K. Pulikovski, Minister of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba Raul Castro Ruz, Chairman of the Central Committee of the People's Party of Cambodia Chea Sim, Chairman of the Communist Party of Tajikistan Sh Shabdolov, Chairman of the Golkar Party of Indonesia Akbar Tandjung, General Secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist) H. S. Surjeet, General Secretary of the National Council of the Communist Party of India A. B. Bardhan, General Secretary of the Central Committee of the All-India Forward Bloc Debabrata Biswas, General Secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam Nong Duc Manh, Chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation Gennadi Zhuganov, Chairperson of the Party for Peace and Unity of Russia Sazhi Umalatova, Chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Bohemia and Moravia Miroslav Grevenicek, First Secretary of the Central Committee of the Ukrainian Communist Party Pyotr Simonenko, Secretary General of the United Nations Kofi Annan, Director-General of the World Health Organization Jong-Wook Lee, Secretary General of the "International Kim Il Sung Prize" Council and Director General of the International Institute of the Juche Idea (IIJI) Vishwanath, Secretary General of the IIJI Kenichi Ogami and Secretary General of the International Liaison Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea Guy Dupre.

articles.content:
DPRK Foreign Minister Meets Delegation of Australian Foreign Ministry
    Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister of the DPRK Paek Nam Sun met and conversed with a delegation of the Foreign Ministry of Australia headed by A. Murray Mclean, who is special envoy of the foreign minister of Australia, which paid a courtesy call on him on Feb.2.
 Earlier, talks were held between Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and the Australian delegation.    
 Views were exchanged on the nuclear issue and the bilateral relations at the conversation and talks.
